intro: Scorodonia sylvestris, commonly known as the forest scurvy grass, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded woodlands and is often found in temperate regions of Europe. Its leaves are finely divided and have a slightly aromatic scent, while its roots contain compounds that were historically used for their medicinal properties. Scorodonia sylvestris is a perennial herb that plays a role in supporting local biodiversity and soil health.
